entry.title: Dr. Lisa B. Thompson | The New Conversation with Dr. Dwight A. McBride

media:group.media:title: Dr. Lisa B. Thompson | The New Conversation with Dr. Dwight A. McBride
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Lisa B. Thompson is an author, playwright, and scholar, whose work examines stereotypes about Black life in the United States, particularly the experiences of the Black middle class. She is a professor of African and African Diaspora Studies at the University of Texas at Austin, and a New School Presidental Visiting Scholar for 2022. She is the author of four books, including 2021's The Mamalogues.
In this series, Dr. Dwight A. McBride, president of The New School, converses with scholars, artists, activists, and a wide range of notable individuals to share their work, their experiences, and their views on a whole host of issues.
Subscribe for more from this series, and follow The New School here: Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thenewschool/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/home?lang=en Medium: https://medium.com/@TheNewSchool Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thenewschool/
Opening 00:00 Intro 00:23 Artist/Scholar 2:10 The Portrayal of the Black Family 7:26 Taking Liberties 13:42

entry.title: Ramon Contreras & Alumni Emily Ekman & Alex Gleason Fight to End Gun Violence | Community Portraits

media:group.media:title: Ramon Contreras & Alumni Emily Ekman & Alex Gleason Fight to End Gun Violence | Community Portraits
media:group.media:description:
Ramon Contreras (BA Politics '23) has been advocating against gun violence since he was a teenager. When seeking professional opportunities, he, alongside Alums Emily Ekman (MA International Affairs ‚Äô13) and Alex Gleason (BA Economics ‚Äô12 and MA Economics ‚Äô13), found a firm that shares their activist values at Mercury public affairs. In light of this year‚Äôs rise in gun violence, the three worked closely with Governors and Mayors to prioritize Gun Violence Awareness across the country.
Read more about Mercury‚Äôs Gun Violence Awareness month efforts here: https://www.gunviolenceawarenessmonthny.com/

media:group.media:title: The Moment is Now: In Dialogue with Changemakers featuring Dant√© Stewart
media:group.media:description:
Recording of the inaugural event of "The Moment is Now: In Dialogue with Changemakers". The minister, essayist, and cultural critic Dant√© Stewart will join Provost Ren√©e T. White for a discussion and reading from Stewart‚Äôs book Shoutin‚Äô in the Fire: An American Epistle (Convergent Books, October 2021).
Programmed by Provost Ren√©e T. White, this series features prominent and emerging scholars, thinkers, artists, and practitioners across disciplines that bring about positive change in the world and connect with the university‚Äôs academic strengths and mission. With a focus on exploring and addressing current topics in art, politics, race, and culture, this series provides an opportunity for students, faculty, staff, and the general.

entry.title: Dr. Teresa Ghilarducci | The New Conversation with Dr. Dwight A. McBride | S3 E 1

media:group.media:title: Dr. Teresa Ghilarducci | The New Conversation with Dr. Dwight A. McBride | S3 E 1
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, nationally-recognized labor economist Dr. Teresa Ghilarducci addresses recession fears, the U.S. lag in treatment of retired workers, and the broader economic landscape in 2022.
Dr. Teresa Ghilarducci is the Bernard L. and Irene Schwartz Professor of Economics and Policy Analysis at@The New School for Social Research. She also directs the Schwartz Center for Economic Policy Analysis at The New School.

Read more about the work of all our MFA Textiles and MFA Fashion Design and Society graduates here: https://blogs.newschool.edu/news/2022/09/mfa-textiles-and-mfa-fashion-design-and-society-celebrate-graduates-at-new-york-fashion-week/

entry.title: Cat Gillespie: Opening New Doors to Collaborative Performance

media:group.media:title: Cat Gillespie: Opening New Doors to Collaborative Performance
media:group.media:description:
Cat's path through the School of Drama is expanding her understanding of her craft, creative risk-taking, and collaboration.
At the College of Performing Arts (CoPA), Cat has found opportunities to break the boundaries of dramatic performance, sparking growth as a playwright and collaborator. Her studies at CoPA's School of Drama have challenged her to take new risks, such as exploring playwriting, and revisit assumptions about collaboration and her craft. Looking back on her time as an undergraduate, Cat recalls she was "engaging creatively every minute" and doing things she thought she couldn't do‚Äîon and off the stage.
Learn more: SCHOOL OF DRAMA | https://newschool.edu/drama COLLEGE OF PERFORMING ARTS | https://newschool.edu/copa THE NEW SCHOOL | https://newschool.edu

entry.title: Niamh Peren: Disrupting the Status Quo by Design | Student Profiles

media:group.media:title: Niamh Peren: Disrupting the Status Quo by Design | Student Profiles
media:group.media:description:
After launching a recycling campaign in New Zealand, Niamh came to Parsons seeking design strategy skills to make broader change. Her collaborative community is inspiring her to disrupt the status quo through new challenges.
Niamh came to Parsons having already launched a grassroots recycling campaign in New Zealand and worked in film. She met a Parsons professor who shared his perspective that with additional design strategy skills, Niamh could augment her professional and change-making capacity. She enrolled and found a collaborative and progressive community to inspire her to disrupt the status quo and take on new challenges related to environmental sustainability and social justice. Learn more: PARSONS SCHOOL OF DESIGN | https://newschool.edu/parsons THE NEW SCHOOL | https://newschool.edu

entry.title: Amal Flower Kay: Interpreting Culture Creatively | Student Profiles

media:group.media:title: Amal Flower Kay: Interpreting Culture Creatively | Student Profiles
media:group.media:description: A fourth-year student in a new hybrid program at Parsons, Amal is combining his interests in art and food to create videos and live performances that explore cultural heritage in creative new ways.

entry.title: Maria, Standhope, & Dalton: Drafting Global Change | Student Profiles

media:group.media:title: Maria, Standhope, & Dalton: Drafting Global Change | Student Profiles
media:group.media:description:
The carefully crafted research report that Schools of Public Engagement (SPE) graduate students recently wrote for the United Nations reflects SPE's commitment to practice-based learning.
Maria Villareal De La Garza(MA International Affairs), Standhope Williams (MA International Affairs), and Dalton Bouchles(MS Environmental Policy and Sustainability Management) recently joined forces in the United Nations Summer Study program, offered by the Schools of Public Engagement at The New School. Reflecting the university's robust interdisciplinary research culture, the trio brought their broad expertise and varied backgrounds to the task of writing a report for the United Nations. The UN may turn their proposals for an equitable and sustainable global build-back into policy. The students' efforts have sparked real-world change and proved the value of practice-based learning.
Learn more: SCHOOLS OF PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT | https://newschool.edu/public-engagement THE NEW SCHOOL | https://newschool.edu
